main event: Two silver, saucer-shaped objects were sighted over Miles City, Montana on April 15, 1966.
interesting points: The objects were described as having a 'classic spinning saucer shape' with 'sharp side edges curving toward top and bottom'.
The objects were estimated to be the size of silver dollars, but larger, around 1.5 inches in size.
The objects were observed to close in on each other briefly before maneuvering back to their original relative positions.
The objects were observed to 'wobble' as they disappeared from view.
The observer was deemed 'extremely religious' and 'most unreliable' by local law enforcement.
